title: What are the best songs to sing for your sister? - Quora

response.answer_text: Get ready for backstory! Last year, Adi and I would fight regularly. We would get into the biggest arguments over the silliest little things. Now, however, we are much more amiable. We can play with each other, poke fun at each other, and roast each other like pros. It is a love-hate relationship. :-) And I realised just one key change that brought this along: I spent time with her. Before, I wouldn’t play with her when she wanted to, only when I wanted to. I wouldn’t do DIY’s with her, and we couldn’t really connect. Over the last few months, she and I have become the only thing stronger than being sisters: we have become friends. She knows that she can Count On Me and that I will always be One Call Away. And I trust her enough to Lean On her. Setting Suns! Anush

Myself, I'd sing either “Daddy never was the Cadillac kind" or "How can I help you to say goodbye” or songs like that which speak of your mutual upbringing and your parents and the lessons you learned. It's really difficult beyond that without more information. I don't know if you're close as siblings or it's been strained for instance. Was she the advice giving big sister? The baby sister you always protected? Hard to give good advice to that question but anything heartfelt and meaningful that fits your lives will do it. Just nothing too romantic sounding or questionable. If you wonder, “Does that sound pervy or is it okay?" Just know,if you have to ask then you know the answer already lol. Hope this helps! Ty.
